intro: Hypobathrum gracile, commonly known as the slender hypobathrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with intricate patterns on the petals. Its roots are specialized for absorbing moisture from the forest floor, and it has a short, creeping rhizome. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
